verses.text_plain: But Job answered and said,
verses.verse_html: 1But Job answered and said,

verses.text_plain: Oh that my grief were throughly weighed, and my calamity laid in the balances together!
verses.verse_html:
2Oh that my grief were throughly weighed, and my calamity laid in the balances together! ▼
▼ laid: Heb. lifted up

footnotes.body_html: ▼ laid: Heb. lifted up

verses.text_plain: For now it would be heavier than the sand of the sea: therefore my words are swallowed up.
verses.verse_html:
3For now it would be heavier than the sand of the sea: therefore my words are swallowed up. ▼
▼ my words…: that is, I want words to express my grief

tokens.text: For now it would be heavier

footnotes.body_text: ▼ my words…: that is, I want words to express my grief
footnotes.body_html: ▼ my words…: that is, I want words to express my grief

verses.text_plain: For the arrows of the Almighty are within me, the poison whereof drinketh up my spirit: the terrors of God do set themselves in array against me.
verses.verse_html: 4For the arrows of the Almighty are within me, the poison whereof drinketh up my spirit: the terrors of God do set themselves in array against me.

verses.text_plain: Doth the wild ass bray when he hath grass? or loweth the ox over his fodder?
verses.verse_html:
5Doth the wild ass bray when he hath grass? or loweth the ox over his fodder? ▼
▼ when he…: Heb. at grass?

footnotes.body_html: ▼ when he…: Heb. at grass?

verses.text_plain: Can that which is unsavoury be eaten without salt? or is there any taste in the white of an egg?
verses.verse_html: 6Can that which is unsavoury be eaten without salt? or is there any taste in the white of an egg?

verses.text_plain: The things that my soul refused to touch are as my sorrowful meat.
verses.verse_html: 7The things that my soul refused to touch are as my sorrowful meat.

verses.text_plain: Oh that I might have my request; and that God would grant me the thing that I long for!
verses.verse_html:
8Oh that I might have my request; and that God would grant me the thing that I long for! ▼
▼ the thing…: Heb. my expectation

tokens.text: the thing that I long for

footnotes.body_html: ▼ the thing…: Heb. my expectation

verses.text_plain: Even that it would please God to destroy me; that he would let loose his hand, and cut me off!
verses.verse_html: 9Even that it would please God to destroy me; that he would let loose his hand, and cut me off!

tokens.text: me; that he would let loose

verses.text_plain: Then should I yet have comfort; yea, I would harden myself in sorrow: let him not spare; for I have not concealed the words of the Holy One.
verses.verse_html: 10Then should I yet have comfort; yea, I would harden myself in sorrow: let him not spare; for I have not concealed the words of the Holy One.

tokens.text: Then should I yet have comfort

verses.text_plain: What is my strength, that I should hope? and what is mine end, that I should prolong my life?
verses.verse_html: 11What is my strength, that I should hope? and what is mine end, that I should prolong my life?

verses.text_plain: Is my strength the strength of stones? or is my flesh of brass?
verses.verse_html:
12Is my strength the strength of stones? or is my flesh of brass? ▼
▼ of brass: Heb. brasen?

footnotes.body_html: ▼ of brass: Heb. brasen?

verses.text_plain: Is not my help in me? and is wisdom driven quite from me?
verses.verse_html: 13Is not my help in me? and is wisdom driven quite from me?

verses.text_plain: To him that is afflicted pity should be shewed from his friend; but he forsaketh the fear of the Almighty.
verses.verse_html:
14To him that is afflicted pity should be shewed from his friend; but he forsaketh the fear of the Almighty. ▼
▼ is afflicted: Heb. melteth

footnotes.body_html: ▼ is afflicted: Heb. melteth

verses.text_plain: My brethren have dealt deceitfully as a brook, and as the stream of brooks they pass away;
verses.verse_html: 15My brethren have dealt deceitfully as a brook, and as the stream of brooks they pass away;

verses.text_plain: Which are blackish by reason of the ice, and wherein the snow is hid:
verses.verse_html: 16Which are blackish by reason of the ice, and wherein the snow is hid:

verses.text_plain: What time they wax warm, they vanish: when it is hot, they are consumed out of their place.
verses.verse_html:
17What time they wax warm, they vanish: when it is hot, they are consumed out of their place. ▼
▼ vanish: Heb. are cut off
 , ▼
▼ when…: Heb. in the heat thereof
 , ▼
▼ consumed: Heb. extinguished

footnotes.body_html: ▼ vanish: Heb. are cut off

footnotes.body_text: ▼ when…: Heb. in the heat thereof
footnotes.body_html: ▼ when…: Heb. in the heat thereof

verses.text_plain: The paths of their way are turned aside; they go to nothing, and perish.
verses.verse_html: 18The paths of their way are turned aside; they go to nothing, and perish.

verses.text_plain: The troops of Tema looked, the companies of Sheba waited for them.
verses.verse_html: 19The troops of Tema looked, the companies of Sheba waited for them.

verses.text_plain: They were confounded because they had hoped; they came thither, and were ashamed.
verses.verse_html: 20They were confounded because they had hoped; they came thither, and were ashamed.

verses.text_plain: For now ye are nothing; ye see my casting down, and are afraid.
verses.verse_html:
21For now ye are nothing; ye see my casting down, and are afraid. ▼
▼ ye are…: or, ye are like to them: Heb. to it
 , ▼
▼ nothing: Heb. not

tokens.text: For now ye are nothing; ye see

footnotes.body_text: ▼ ye are…: or, ye are like to them: Heb. to it
footnotes.body_html: ▼ ye are…: or, ye are like to them: Heb. to it

verses.text_plain: Did I say, Bring unto me? or, Give a reward for me of your substance?
verses.verse_html: 22Did I say, Bring unto me? or, Give a reward for me of your substance?

tokens.text: unto me? or, Give a reward

verses.text_plain: Or, Deliver me from the enemy’s hand? or, Redeem me from the hand of the mighty?
verses.verse_html: 23Or, Deliver me from the enemy’s hand? or, Redeem me from the hand of the mighty?

verses.text_plain: Teach me, and I will hold my tongue: and cause me to understand wherein I have erred.
verses.verse_html: 24Teach me, and I will hold my tongue: and cause me to understand wherein I have erred.

tokens.text: me, and I will hold my tongue

verses.text_plain: How forcible are right words! but what doth your arguing reprove?
verses.verse_html: 25How forcible are right words! but what doth your arguing reprove?

verses.text_plain: Do ye imagine to reprove words, and the speeches of one that is desperate, which are as wind?
verses.verse_html: 26Do ye imagine to reprove words, and the speeches of one that is desperate, which are as wind?

verses.text_plain: Yea, ye overwhelm the fatherless, and ye dig a pit for your friend.
verses.verse_html:
27Yea, ye overwhelm the fatherless, and ye dig a pit for your friend. ▼
▼ ye overwhelm: Heb. ye cause to fall upon

footnotes.body_text: ▼ ye overwhelm: Heb. ye cause to fall upon
footnotes.body_html: ▼ ye overwhelm: Heb. ye cause to fall upon

verses.text_plain: Now therefore be content, look upon me; for it is evident unto you if I lie.
verses.verse_html:
28Now therefore be content, look upon me; for it is evident unto you if I lie. ▼
▼ evident…: Heb. before your face

footnotes.body_html: ▼ evident…: Heb. before your face

verses.text_plain: Return, I pray you, let it not be iniquity; yea, return again, my righteousness is in it.
verses.verse_html:
29Return, I pray you, let it not be iniquity; yea, return again, my righteousness is in it. ▼
▼ in it: that is, in this matter

tokens.text: I pray you, let it not be iniquity

footnotes.body_text: ▼ in it: that is, in this matter
footnotes.body_html: ▼ in it: that is, in this matter

verses.text_plain: Is there iniquity in my tongue? cannot my taste discern perverse things?
verses.verse_html:
30Is there iniquity in my tongue? cannot my taste discern perverse things? ▼
▼ my taste: Heb. my palate

footnotes.body_html: ▼ my taste: Heb. my palate
